intro: Prenanthes lessingii, commonly known as the lesser arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Araceae family, characterized by its unique inflorescence consisting of a spadix surrounded by a spathe. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds, thriving in moist to aquatic environments. Its leaves are arrow-shaped, with a distinctive notched base, and it produces small, greenish-white flowers. Prenanthes lessingii is often found in shallow water or damp soil, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
